fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Confluence top Menu bar disappears if we scroll down a page with Change History macro inserted.
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Confluence 7.0.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page which is long enough to scroll down while viewing
 # Insert Change History Macro and update the page
 # Open the page and scroll down a bit
 # We see that top Menu bar disappears, as we scroll down

h3. Expected Results

Top Menu bar should stay on top like it does when we scroll down in any other Confluence page which is long enough to scroll down.

Shared the mov file "Normal Page.mov"
h3. Actual Results

Top menu bar disappears as we scroll down the page

Shared the mov file "Page with Change History Macro.mov"
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence top Menu bar disappears if we scroll down a page with Change History macro inserted.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
 # user A: create a wiki page, upload an attachment and add a link from the page to the attachment
 # user B: watch the page
 # user A: modify the page (eg. add text below the link)
 # user B: receives an emai; notification

h3. Expected Result
Email Notification should contain the correct attachment url/link
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-22 at 16.17.35.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Actual Result
Email notification with attachment link points to "#" instead of the attachment correct link
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-22 at 16.19.02.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Links in notification e-mails pointing to attachments refer to wiki homepage instead of the attachment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It is not possible to enable Page Profiling on Confluence 7.0.1 and up. Enabling it on startup as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/troubleshooting-slow-performance-using-page-request-profiling-200987.html#TroubleshootingSlowPerformanceUsingPageRequestProfiling-StartConfluencewithProfilingEnabled] also does not work.

h3. Environment

Tested on Confluence 7.0.1 and 7.1.0 beta.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to Logging and Profiling
# Click on Enable Profiling
# Check the {{atlassian-confluence.log}}

h3. Expected Results

Profiling logs are printed.

h3. Actual Results

No further logs are printed.
 
h3. Notes

This feature works fine on Confluence 6, tested on 6.15.2

h3. Workaround

No known workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Page Profiling does not work on Confluence 7+

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user elects to have Confluence displayed in Danish, the footer links will break.
h3. Environment
* Confluence server 7.0.1
* User selects Danish (Denmark) language

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Switch user language to Danish (Denmark)
 # Save change
 # Notice the footer link is now broken.

h3. Expected Results

The footer link should continue to function.
h3. Actual Results

A broken link is displayed in the footer.

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/69610i8EF616328785A6C6/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

If the Danish language is required there is no workaround.

If the Danish language is not required then select another language.
fields.summary: Broken link in footer for Danish language

h2. Issue Summary

 [User List macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/user-list-macro-964960934.html] performance regression since Confluence 6.6
h2. Environment

Confluence 6.13
h2. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have the User List macro enabled in Confluence 6.13
 # Run performance testing to compare against Confluence 6.6 with it also enabled

The results will show that 6.6 outperforms 6.13 with the User List macro enabled. 
h2. Expected Results

Performance results will be similar or better in 6.13 than in 6.6
h2. Actual Results

Confluence 6.6 outperforms 6.13 until the User List macro is disabled, after which 6.13 is as good or better. 
h2. Notes

This issue has been observed to cause high GC activity and the Total Transaction /sec during performance testing to trend downward with Average Response time to trend upwards. This is stable when the plugin is disabled.

h4. User Login Listener

Confluence 6.6's implementation of the User List macro has the "User Login Listener" disabled by default:

!UserLister_6.6.png|width=575,height=341!

In Confluence 6.13, the "User Login Listener" stopped showing in the module list because of refactoring done to use spring-scanner. Unfortunately, because of this, there is no way to disable the submodule but to disable the plugin itself. 
h2. Workaround

Disable the User Lister add-on in version 6.13
fields.summary: User List macro performance concerns in Confluence 6.13

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When developing a Confluence theme by following [https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/adding-a-theme-icon/] and adding a custom icon, the icon won't be displayed in the admin theme configuration screen. Instead, a default theme icon is displayed.
h3. Environment

Confluence 7.0.1 and up.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence theme and add an icon resource to it as per the instructions on the page above
 # Navigate to the admin theme configuration screen

h3. Expected Results

The custom configured icon should appear.
h3. Actual Results

The default theme icon is displayed instead.
h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Including a theme icon in Confluence 7.0.1 and up won't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Results of page properties report macro with filter "text include" will show incorrect results.

h3. Environment
Confluence 7.0.3 or 6.15.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with label TEST and title TEST
# In Content add page properties and then add text for it to be eg "One page QA Manager"
# Create another page with page properties report macro.
# Use label TEST.
# Add "including text" to it with the string "IT QA Manager" or "This QA Manager"

h3. Expected Results
As the word IT/This does not exist on page TEST, we will not see any result in it.

h3. Actual Results
We actually see the result of the page TEST.

h3. Notes
It looks like the search is ignoring the word IT and This and just searches for "QA Manager". During testings, I was able to see a few other random 2 letter words, but I did not record them, and can not replicate the behavior with them again.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Results of page properties report macro with filter "including text" will show incorrect results if using words like "IT" or "This"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User can comment on attachment, accordingly PageID for the comment would be the attachment's content id. Currently HibernateSpaceDao#getSpacesContainingCommentsByUser implementation assume the container for comment is of type of AbstractPage only, which will throw ClassCastException. 

h3.Environment * Confluence 6.13
 Steps to Reproduce
 It is hard to reproduce from UI, but can be reproduced when calling SOAP API to remove user. 
h3. Expected Results

Our implementation would handle comment of attachements well, HibernateSpaceDao#getSpacesContainingCommentsByUser will return correct result.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
 Remote error: The application was unable to serve your request: java.lang.ClassCastException: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Attachment cannot be cast to com.atlassian.confluence.pages.AbstractPage
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Container of a comment could be an attachment, not only AbstractPage

fields.description:
The customer has an email with Single quote (') character and this is not accepted by Confluence when the user is added. But the same user can be added to Jira without any issue. 

For example *test.emailD'Silva@abc.com*

The customer has enabled SSO authentication and since the email ID doesn't match the username in confluence, the user is not authenticated. 
h3. Expected Results

Confluence should accept a user name and email address with  Single quote (') 
h3. Actual Results

Get an error Usernames cannot contain the characters '+', ',', '\', '<', '>', ', or ".
fields.summary: Confluence does not support Single quote (') character is user name and email address

fields.description:
h3. Issue summary
If you create a page using the REST call {{/rest/api/content}} and include a DOCTYPE declaration in the storage format, it will throw the following error.
{code}    "message": "Error parsing xhtml: Unrecognized XML directive; expected CDATA or comment ('<![CDATA[' or '<!--').\n at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,323]",
    "reason": "Bad Request",
    "statusCode": 400{code}

Removing the DOCTYPE declaration allows the page to be created successfully.

h3. Suggestion
Add a method to detect the DOCTYPE declaration if this is passed in the {{body.storage.value}} of a REST API call, and remove it so the request is successful.
fields.summary: Remove any DOCTYPE declaration if passed through 'body.storage.value' in an API call

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Suppose a user send a request access to a certain page. Approving the request revokes access privileges of all others except the requester. This happens if the page is affected by CONFSERVER-32712 .
 
Two underlying problems
* [Requesting access to a restricted page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-restrictions-139414.html#PageRestrictions-Getaccesstoarestrictedpage] is enabled even though it only has inherited restriction. 
* Approving the request revokes other's privilege to view the page 

h3. Environment
Confirmed in Confluence 7.0.2 but would be replicated in the newer version as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add SMTP server for Confluence
 # Login as {{admin}}, an administrator user
 # Add {{user1}} and {{user2}} 
 # Remove them from {{confluence-users}}
 # Grant "Use Confluence" permission individually to them 
 # Create pages with such tree structure
{code:none}
  RootPage
    ├── pageA
    └── pageB
{code}
 # In space permission, 
 ** Restrict view access for RootPage only to {{user1}}, {{user2}} 
 ** Restrict view access for PageB only to {{user1}} 
 # Add page C below page B
{code:none}
  RootPage
    ├── pageA
    └── pageB
        └── pageC
{code}
 # Move page C to below page A
{code:none}
  RootPage
    ├── pageA
        └── pageC
    └── pageB
{code}
# Login to {{user2}} and visit pageC

h3. Expected Results
{{user2}} can see pageC.
Otherwise {{user2}} cannot send request access even the page is affected by CONFSERVER-32712 . 

h3. Actual Results

* {{user2}} cannot see pageC and the access request screen is enabled. Request can be sent as 
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-18 at 16.40.20.png|thumbnail! 
* Approving request will make PageC be only visible to {{user2}}  
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-18 at 16.40.50.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The potential problem of this issue is CONFSERVER-32712, so resolving the bug will also resolve this.

h3. Workaround
Don't send access request to any page that is affected by CONFSERVER-32712
fields.summary: Approving page access request revokes access privileges of all others if page had been moved from restricted page tree

fields.description:
Steps:
 # Create a table within the *Chart Macro* as per the details below
 ** 
||Plan||Activity||Start||End||Status||
|Stage 1|1.1|6/25/2013|7/10/2013|30%|
|Stage 1|1.2|6/25/2013|7/10/2013|10%|
|Stage 2|2.1|7/13/2013|11/28/2013|40%|
|Stage 3|3.1|12/1/2013|12/25/2013|35%|

 # Under the *Chart Macro* settings for column, enter the following {{,,1,2,3,4,5}}

h3. Current:
 The *Chart Macro* doesn't allow the chart to be created because it expects the second column to be a date. 

h3. Expected:
 The *Chart Macro* allows the second column to not be a date and creates a chart using data from all the specified columns

h3. Workaround:
 Remove '2' from the *Column* configuration. The *Chart Macro* will generate the following chart
 !image-2019-10-18-15-12-44-352.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Able to add breakdown for Gantt Chart in Chart Macro

fields.description:
For monitoring purposes, it would be helpful to have an endpoint that would return the output of the page http://<confluence>/admin/viewindexqueue.action, focusing the output to the amount of pending indexing items in the queue.

That'd help customers have visibility of their index queue in a proactive way, having them take measures when that queue is increasing and not decreasing a given period of time.
fields.summary: REST API Endpoint for Content Indexing Queue pending items

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer wants to change a previously *Read Only* User Directory (LDAP Connector) to *Read Only, with Local Groups* and set a *Default Group Memberships* , but is unable to proceed and save due to an error _Oops - an error has occurred_.
h3. Environment

Issue reproduced in Confluence Server and Data Center 6.6.7 and 6.13.8 with Oracle database with Active Directory LDAP Connector.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup Confluence DC with Oracle
 # Create a new User Directory as Active Directory LDAP Connector, Read Only
 # Check on the database that the following line was created:
{code:java}
> select * from cwd_directory_attribute where attribute_name='autoAddGroups';

DIRECTORY_ID  ATTRIBUTE_NAME  ATTRIBUTE_VALUE   
------------  --------------  ----------------  
294914        autoAddGroups   NULL  
{code}

 # Edit the Directory, change it to Read Only with Local Groups, input a group name in Default Group Membership
 # Try to save

h3. Expected Results

Save Succesful
h3. Actual Results

When clicking Save and Test, gets the following error message:
{panel}
Oops - an error has occurred
 System Error
 Cause
 Stack Trace:[hide]

Referer URL
 http://<base-URL>/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/?directoryId=294914&xsrfTokenName=atl_token&xsrfTokenValue=01a6c92ddc7fa94142217ecb29a43faf0602002c
{panel}
!save-userdir-error.png|thumbnail!

In the application logs we can observe the following:
{code:java}
2019-10-17 11:57:13,829 ERROR [http-nio-2667-exec-2] [atlassian.plugin.servlet.ServletModuleContainerServlet] service Request processing failed; nested exception is org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: could not execute statement; sql=n/a; SQL []; ORA-00001: unique constraint (CONFLUENCE667.SYS_C0013078) violated
; nested exception is java.sql.SQLIntegrityConstraintViolationException: ORA-00001: unique constraint (CONFLUENCE667.SYS_C0013078) violated
 -- referer: http://localhost:2667/c667/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/?directoryId=294914&xsrfTokenName=atl_token&xsrfTokenValue=01a6c92ddc7fa94142217ecb29a43faf0602002c | url: /c667/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/ | traceId: 263aca2e6ddf60e2 | userName: admin
org.springframework.web.util.NestedServletException: Request processing failed; nested exception is org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: could not execute statement; sql=n/a; SQL []; ORA-00001: unique constraint (CONFLUENCE667.SYS_C0013078) violated
; nested exception is java.sql.SQLIntegrityConstraintViolationException: ORA-00001: unique constraint (CONFLUENCE667.SYS_C0013078) violated

{code}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a page and it is tried to insert an Emoticon using the Emoticon menu, no Emoticon is inserted.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.15.9

 * Ubuntu 16.04
 * Chrome, Firefox and Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce

When editing a page, select the *Insert more content* option and enter the *Emoticon* menu.
 # Go to any page and access the editor
 # Open *Insert more content* at the top bar and enter the *Emoticon* menu
 ** If the HipChat plugin is fully disabled, this is the menu exhibited:
 ** !select emoticon window.png|width=173,height=242!
 # Try inserting any Emoticon

h3. Expected Results

The Emoticons are inserted in the page. It was suppose to work without the need of enabling any plugin, specially when integration with HipChat is being discontinued.
h3. Actual Results

The page remains unchanged and no emoticon is inserted.
h3. Workaround

Enable the HipChat plugin again:
 # Go to *General configuration* > *Manage Apps*
 # Click the dropdown menu in the center and select *All Apps*
 # Locate and enable *Confluence HipChat Emoticons Plugin*
 # Go to any page and access the editor
 # Open *Insert more content* at the top bar and enter the *Emoticon* menu
 ** This the menu exhibited now:
 ** !insert emoticons with hipchat plugin enabled - nonadmin user.PNG|width=303,height=285!

The dialogue box will be telling the users "...Confluence is not integrated with Hipchat. Please contact your administrator for integration.", which can be inconvenient.
fields.summary: Unable to insert emoticons in Confluence editor if Hip Chat is disabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On pages having multiple Jira issue macro (usually tables) the response time from Jira can be longer than 60 seconds. This is more than the front-end JavaScript configured in Confluence.

h3. Environment

* Confluence v6.12.0
* Jira v8.3.3


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with multiple Jira issue Macros
#* Especially filter which display as tables
#* Data from Jira should be large, so it reaches Confluence after 1 minute
# Refresh the page in Confluence

h3. Expected Results

Confluence will display the output of all Jira issue macros.


h3. Actual Results

Confluence doesn't display the output for Jira issues which are received by Confluence after 1 minute and shows the following error.
{code}
(!) Refresh didn't work. Try again or click an issue to see it in Jira.
{code}

Some Jira issues macros will still be displayed, whose data has been received under 1 minute.

h3. Notes

Confluence front-end pulls the data from backend via the following JavaScript (JS)
{code:title=fetching-job.js}
this.TICK_RETRIES=[0,1*g,1*g,2*g,3*g,5*g,8*g,13*g,13*g,13*g]
{code}

This counts to a total of 59 seconds. This means any data received by Confluence after 1 minute of page load will not be displayed.

This issue is different from *backend* [HTTP timeout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/timeouts-in-the-jira-issues-macro-or-highlighting-plugin-726108967.html] between Confluence and Jira. 

h3. *Diagnosis*

Confluence sends the following request to check whether Confluence has finished receiving data.
{code}
          "url": "<BaseURL>/rest/jiraanywhere/1.0/jira/clientIds/"
{code}

This can be seen in HAR file and have two responses:
* 200 --> Means all data has been received
* 202 --> Still receiving

This means that if the last web-request had 202, we will run into this issue.

h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira issue macros taking more than 1 minute are not displayed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, there is no method available to get all children pages from a parent page, including all levels of the tree. Only direct children are returned from the existing methods.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement the same endpoints that are available on Confluence Cloud:

* [Get content descendants|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-descendant-get]
* [Get content descendants by type|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-descendant-type-get]

Both requests are available on server instances already. However, the first one only returns attachments and comments. The second one returns the following error if accessed:
* /rest/api/content/<ID>/descendant/page
{code}
{
  "statusCode": 501,
  "data": {
    "authorized": false,
    "valid": true,
    "allowedInReadOnlyMode": true,
    "errors": [],
    "successful": false
  },
  "message": "Page children is currently only supported for direct children",
  "reason": "Not Implemented"
}
{code}

h3. Why this is important

Making those methods available would greatly reduce the effort to build the full page tree using Rest API.
 
h3. Workaround 

At the moment, the only option is to recursively navigate through the tree, one level at a time.
fields.summary: Implement "/<ID>/descendant/page" Rest API endpoint on Confluence server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After turning off Collaborative editing, synchrony proxy will still try to connect to synchrony until handshake timeout is reached thus a number of http threads can be created during this. In the catalina.out, there are a number of warning that synchrony proxy failed to stop http exec threads. 
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Server 7.0.1
 * Synchrony-proxy running in front of Synchrony

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login as admin
 # Go to general configuration -> collaborative editing 
 # Turn off collaborative editing
 # Check catalina.out (could be done by creating and downloading support zip)

h3. Expected Results

Synchrony proxy stop trying to talk to synchrony. No http threads will be holding to connect to synchrony until timeout.   
h3. Actual Results

Synchrony proxy is still trying to connect to synchrony until timeout. 

The below exception is thrown in the catalina.out file:
{noformat}
29-Sep-2019 21:57:13.728 WARNING [Catalina-utility-1] org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoaderBase.clearReferencesThreads The web application [synchrony-proxy] appears to have started a thread named [http-nio-8090-exec-1] but has failed to stop it. This is very likely to create a memory leak. Stack trace of thread: sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method) java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.parkNanos(LockSupport.java:215) java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$Signaller.block(CompletableFuture.java:1695) java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool.managedBlock(ForkJoinPool.java:3323) java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.timedGet(CompletableFuture.java:1775) java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.get(CompletableFuture.java:1915) com.atlassian.synchrony.proxy.websocket.WebSocketUpstreamHandler.getSynchronySession(WebSocketUpstreamHandler.java:64) com.atlassian.synchrony.proxy.websocket.WebSocketProxy.afterConnectionEstablished(WebSocketProxy.java:47) org.springframework.web.socket.handler.PerConnectionWebSocketHandler.afterConnectionEstablished(PerConnectionWebSocketHandler.java:81) org.springframework.web.socket.handler.WebSocketHandlerDecorator.afterConnectionEstablished(WebSocketHandlerDecorator.java:70) org.springframework.web.socket.handler.LoggingWebSocketHandlerDecorator.afterConnectionEstablished(LoggingWebSocketHandlerDecorator.java:48) org.springframework.web.socket.handler.ExceptionWebSocketHandlerDecorator.afterConnectionEstablished(ExceptionWebSocketHandlerDecorator.java:48) org.springframework.web.socket.adapter.standard.StandardWebSocketHandlerAdapter.onOpen(StandardWebSocketHandlerAdapter.java:103) org.apache.tomcat.websocket.server.WsHttpUpgradeHandler.init(WsHttpUpgradeHandler.java:133) org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol$ConnectionHandler.process(AbstractProtocol.java:899) org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.doRun(NioEndpoint.java:1587) org.apache.tomcat.util.net.SocketProcessorBase.run(SocketProcessorBase.java:49) java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149) java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624) org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61) java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{noformat}
h3. Notes

Confluence might become unresponsive while the internal synchrony-proxy is still trying to reach Synchrony. You can confirm if that is the case by taking thread dumps, all HTTP EXEC threads will be in the following state:
{code}
"http-nio-8090-exec-48" #320 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f9c8c0e8000 nid=0x5d8e waiting on condition [0x00007f9c78a0a000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x0000000768ad32d0> (a java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$Signaller)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.parkNanos(LockSupport.java:215)
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$Signaller.block(CompletableFuture.java:1695)
	at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool.managedBlock(ForkJoinPool.java:3323)
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.timedGet(CompletableFuture.java:1775)
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.get(CompletableFuture.java:1915)
	at com.atlassian.synchrony.proxy.websocket.WebSocketUpstreamHandler.getSynchronySession(WebSocketUpstreamHandler.java:64)
{code}

h3. Workaround

h4. Option 1
Set system properties -Datlassian.synchrony.proxy.handshake.timeout.sec=1 to set a short timeout for synchrony proxy handshake.  
h4. Option 2
Point your Load Balancer or Reverse Proxy directly to Synchrony and avoid using the internal proxy. More details [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/possible-confluence-and-synchrony-configurations-958779064.html#PossibleConfluenceandSynchronyConfigurations-DirecttoSynchronywithareverseproxy].
fields.summary: After collaborative editing is turning off, synchrony proxy should stop attempts to talk to synchrony

Steps to Reproduce # Turn Collaborative Editing *OFF* in Confluence # Create a new page # Insert a table and set it to *Fixed width* # (optional) enlarge the cell's width (i) The bug can still be replicated without this step but enlarging it can help easily identify the extra line break # Insert another table below in the same page (i) This can be either Fixed width or Responsive # At this point, the storage format should look something like below: {code}


{code} # Copy any text and paste it into the upper table with Fixed width set h3. Expected Results No extra line break will be added in between tables h3. Actual Results Extra line breaks will be added *randomly* on every paste action [^line break between table.mp4] (i) Note that not every paste triggers the issue This can be further verified by spotting the extra lines in the Storage Format: {code}


{code} h3. Workaround * Enable Collaborative Editing; or * Manually remove the extra line breaks h3. Information The main criteria for this bug to be replicated are: * Collaborative Editing must be turned *OFF* * There is more than 1 tables in the page and the table at the higher position needs to be set to *Fixed width* The bug can still be replicable regardless of the conditions below: * The number of Rows and Columns is irrelevant * Whether the table has Header row/column is irrelevant * Whether the text is copied from Confluence page itself or somewhere else without any format (eg: Notepad) is irrelevant

fields.description:
In reviewing [File conversion service causes out of memory errors in Confluence 5.7 or above|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/file-conversion-service-causes-out-of-memory-errors-in-confluence-5-7-or-above-703398523.html] the suggestions that were provided are not the most ideal situations in handling what essentially is a situation where there could be an unbounded memory utilization that will take out the entire application.
h2. Documented Suggestions and There Issues

The suggestion to increase the heap increases assume that we know what the max amount of memory is going to be needed to complete the operation, which we don't. Therefor, it becomes a game of chicken. Also requires the reservation of large amounts of memory that probably wont actually be used.

Disabling the file conversion service is not really a good choice, as it makes working in the UI awkward as panels show but with no content, thus making the implementation look broken.

The last suggestion for Data Center to reroute the file conversion traffic essentially is saying to take a node and dedicate it to just this operation, but it still doesn't solve the issue of the node/instance going out when a large file is hit. It also introduces configuration complexity and yet another thing that can go wrong to have to handle that makes the overall product look unstable.
h2. Proposed Solution

As this has to do with a situation of a potentially unbounded memory need event, much like you have already accomplished with the Synchrony service, this service should be pushed off to an independent process that is controlled by the Confluence parent process. Thus one could monitor the process for health, re-configure it 'on the fly', restart it, and have it do the potentially hazardous work without putting the Confluence Core process at risk. There are a number of 3rd party plugins that have worked out how to move 'high risk' work off to child processes so that they don't put the 'prime' instance at risk also. This should also help with the perceived overall stability of the app as having to restart it randomly doesn't help.
fields.summary: Feature improvement to File conversion service

fields.description:
Widget Connector should support youtube URLs from *youtube-nocookie.com* domain

According to European Data Protection Laws Youtube Videos have to be embedded using the www.youtube-nocookie.com URL.
 Widget Connector does not work when using a youtube-nocookie domain.

+*Current Behaviour*+
 Widget Connector currently accepts youtube links like the following format:
 [https://www.youtube.com/watch?t=15&v=LhHKkodOPFo]

+*Suggested feature*+

Should also be compatible with youtube links from youtube-nocookie domain like the following:
 [https://www.youtube-nocookie.com/embed/LhHKkodOPFo]
fields.summary: Widget Connector should support youtube URLs from youtube-nocookie.com domain

fields.description: It would be great to have CSS 3 supported, as its the latest CSS available and Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) are an industry-standard way of styling a web page. The content of a page is rendered with HTML, and its look and feel is determined by CSS files.
fields.summary: CSS 3 Support for Confluence

fields.description:
If you export a Confluence page containing an image to a Word .doc format and then reimport that file back into Confluence, the image will be replaced by a red "x".

h3. Environment
* 6.13.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page.
# Attach an image to it.
# Export the page to Word.  This results in the creation of a .doc file.
# Import the exported .doc back into Confluence.

h3. Expected Results
The resulting page should render the original image contained in the exported .doc file from Confluence.

h3. Actual Results
If you open the resulting page, Confluence displays a little red 'x' instead of the image.
 
h3. Workaround
The workaround for this issue would be to save the .doc file to a .docx format in Word.  Then import the .docx file into Confluence.
fields.summary: Import of Word .doc file containing an image results in image replaced by red "x"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Publishing or discarding a draft of the page will reset the position of the scroll in the sidebar depending on the position of the scroll of the discarded/saved page at the time of discarding/publishing.

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.15.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a loot of pages in the sidebar (so that scroll appears).
# Create one large page (so that scroll appears).
# Move scroll on the sidebar to the top.
# Edit the large page.
# Scroll to the bottom of the page.
# Publish or discard changes on that page.
# Observe the position of the scroll in the sidebar area.

h3. Expected Results
The sidebar scroll will be on the top of the page or where we left it.

h3. Actual Results
The scroll will be at the bottom, mimicking the scroll position of the edited page (last known position)

h3. Notes
Large content users will be impacted by this as they constantly need to find the correct location and exact page if they want to edit the neighbor page.

h3. Workaround
A potential workaround until the fix is implemented might be to reset position of the scroll to position of selected page in sidebar:
{code}
<script type="text/javascript">
setTimeout(function(){AJS.$('.ia-scrollable-section').scrollTop( AJS.$('.plugin_pagetree_current').offset().top);}, 200);
</script>
{code}
fields.summary: Publishing or discarding draft of the page will reset position of scroll in sidebar depending on the position of the scroll of discarded/saved page.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, in order to administer Confluence plugins, users need to have System Administrator Permissions.

If a Confluence administrator needs to allow some users to administer only the Confluence plugins, giving those users System Administrator permissions will give them total control over the Confluence instance, which is inconvenient.
h3. Suggested Solution

Separate the permission to administer plugins from System Administrator permissions.

This way, users can be authorized to administer plugins without having permission to the remaining General Configurations (*Configuration*, *Users & Security*, *Look and Feel* and *Administration*).
h3. Workaround

Currently there is none.
fields.summary: Separate Plugin Administration permission from System Administrator permissions

fields.description:
(i) This is cloned from an archived ticket SOURCE-109
h3. Issue Summary

Adding in HTML/CSS code to the source editor on a page does not always provide the desired result. With tables for example it is possible to alter the table appearance using the source editor and it appears in the editing window. As soon as the changes are saved and the page is displayed these customisations are wiped. Going back into the edit view and then the source editor reveals that all the added HTML/CSS has been removed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page, save it and then go back to edit to get access to the Source Editor code button.
 # Add some customisations to a table or section of text, such as colour change using HTML. Preview the page to see the changes in effect.
 # Save page

h3. Expected Results

The change is reflected properly.
h3. Actual Results

Once the page is displayed, all previewed changes are lost. And if you go back in to edit the page and open up the source editor, all added in changes wiped.
h3. Note

This is understandable if it breaks the underlying code of Confluence, but it is happening when adding in simple features such as a colour change or specifying the width of a table.
 This has proved problematic when displaying large amounts of documentation information for reference, most of which needs to be in a consistent custom format.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Source Editor is losing changes when page is saved

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Team Calendars does a great job of simplifying how timezones are handled by displaying the events according to what is defined in the user profile. Here are the details:

* [Understanding Time Zones and the Display of Event Times in Team Calendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/understanding-time-zones-and-the-display-of-event-times-in-team-calendar-806457993.html]

However, this is not clear until the end-user checks the document above. While looking at the TC contents, we cannot see the timezone indicated anywhere, which can cause some confusion.

h3. Suggested Solution

A simple tooltip or note could be created to indicate which timezone is set in the user profile and explaining that this is being used to display the events. Example:

{quote}
You are viewing events in GMT-X timezone which is currently set in your profile. Click here to change it.
{quote}

Adding a link to the user profile would also be very helpful in case the user needs to update it.

h3. Why this is important

The proposed feature would avoid confusion about timezones in TC. Also, creating a link that is displayed in the macro or the events so the user can quickly change the setting would improve the quality of life while using the product.
fields.summary: Team Calendars could show a note with the timezone of the user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Previewing PDF or Office files via Office macros like PDF macro stops working after sometime
h3. Environment

7.0.1 and above
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an Office (or PDF) attachment to a page
 # Use Powerpoint (ppt) macro to preview the attachment
 # The attachment will work
 # Wait overnight
 # Open the page with another browser or open with private browsing mode (not to use browser cache)

h3. Expected Results

Browser displays image of the office file
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-04 at 14.37.20.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The preview image is broken.
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-04 at 14.37.00.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

The preview image is stored under {{<confluence-home>/viewfile/temp}} directory, and apparently {{scheduledjob.desc.cleanupTrigger}} job is clearing up the temp directory. This is a scheduled job that runs at 2 AM automatically.
h3. Workaround

Disabling the [Scheduled Job|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/scheduled-jobs-96567525.html] scheduledjob.desc.cleanupTrigger may *not* stop the job from running. This is due to a new bug that disabling a system scheduled job (e.g. cleanupTrigger) continues to run post restart of Confluence:
 - CONFSERVER-59501 - Disabling a system scheduled job continues to run post restart of Confluence

In order to properly disable it, we need to *disable* the *Office Connector* module related to the {{cleanupTrigger}} job.
 # Navigate to Manage Apps in Confluence (requires Confluence admin permission)
 # Filter it by *System* apps and search for *_Office Connector Plugin_*. Click on it to expand.
 # Click on *Modules* to expand the list and look for {{File Cache Cleanup (cleanupTrigger)}}.
 # Leave the mouse cursor on it and the *Disable* button will show up. Click on it.
 (!) For broken files, it's necessary to reupload in order to recreate them.

Or, utilize the thumbnail feature of [Display Files and Images|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/display-files-and-images-245827130.html] instead of Office macro.
fields.summary: Preview macros for PDF and PowerPoint stops working after sometime

The documentation for the [User List Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/user-list-macro-139546.html] mentions under the section *Configuring the User List macro* the steps to enable the the *User Log In Listener* module. However this module currently does not exist.

There is no extra step required to enable the *Display Online/Offline Users* filter for the macro.

 # Select *System* from the drop down and search for *User Lister*

There is no *User Log In Listener* module under the *User Lister* system plugin.
h3. Notes

This module is still listed, and can be enabled/disabled, in version 6.6.1 and older.

No workaround is needed for enabling the *Display Online/Offline Users* filter, however there is now no option to disable this filter in the macro.

h3. Issue Summary

Using the JAVA API methods *com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject.removeOutgoingLink()* and *com.atlassian.confluence.links.DefaultLinkManager.removeLink()* in a script is not working
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.15.9
 * [ScriptRunner for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215215/scriptrunner-for-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview] 5.5.11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a test space create [undefined page links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/undefined-page-links-139580.html] in at least 2 different pages;
 # Open the *Script Console* under the Administration console;
 # Copy the contents of the attached [^Script.txt] into the console;
 # Edit the space key in line 24 to match your test space;
 # Click on *Run* - verify that the output lists the different pages created and the undefined links created in step #1;
 # Open the pages listed on the output of the previous steps;
 # Go back to the *Script Console* and uncomment the code {{dlm.removeLink(link2)}} in line 37;
 # Click on *Run*.

h3. Expected Results

The undefined links listed in the script output should be removed from the page.
h3. Actual Results

After step #6 the page links are still present in the pages.
 Running the script after step #Y just returns {{null}} and the below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian_confluence.log}}:
{noformat}
2019-09-24 13:37:02,768 WARN [http-nio-26156-exec-2] [runner.rest.common.UserScriptEndpoint] exec Script console script failed: 
 -- referer: http://localhost:26156/c6156/plugins/servlet/scriptrunner/admin/console | url: /c6156/rest/scriptrunner/latest/user/exec/ | traceId: 00b5911e85ae0161 | userName: admin | sr.execution.id: 587f7765-62a7-480a-bb03-ae1ddb5b9f33
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.links.DefaultLinkManager.removeLink(DefaultLinkManager.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.links.LinkManager$removeLink.call(Unknown Source)
	at Script53.run(Script53.groovy:42)
...
{noformat}
h3. Notes

The classes and methods in question are documented in:
 * [Class ContentEntityObject|https://docs.atlassian.com/ConfluenceServer/javadoc/6.15.9/com/atlassian/confluence/core/ContentEntityObject.html]
 * [Class DefaultLinkManager|https://docs.atlassian.com/ConfluenceServer/javadoc/6.15.9/com/atlassian/confluence/links/DefaultLinkManager.html]

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When clicking on "Add existing calendar" option on Team Calendars screen, the list of existing calendars is shown ordered by Subscribers in an ascending manner. This results in UI showing the least popular calendars first - in order to see the more popular calendars it's necessary to scroll to the bottom of the list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add three users in Confluence (user1, user2, user3)
 # Create three calendars in Team Calendars (Calendar1, Calendar2, Calendar3)
 # Make user1 watch Calendar1
 # Make user2 watch Calendar1 and Calendar2
 # Make user3 watch all three calendars
 # Go to ellipsis and click on "Add existing calendar"

h3. Expected Results
A list of existing calendars is shown ordered by "Subscribers" in a *descending* manner.
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-02 at 6.37.45 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
A list of existing calendars is shown ordered by "Subscribers" in an *ascending* manner.
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-02 at 6.36.31 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The bug does not manifest itself on older TC versions like 6.0.25.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior other than using an older version of Team Calendars. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Popular Calendars dialog shows list of calendars sorted ascendingly by the Subscribers column

fields.description: The current Help Tips section of the custom HTML configuration page does not include any information on what HTML should or should not be used in the "At end of the HEAD", "At beginning of the BODY", or "At end of the BODY" sections. For example, it would be helpful to note that the HEAD section should not contain any content that is expected to be viewable by end users, since the HEAD section is traditionally reserved for metadata about the HTML page.
fields.summary: Improve Custom HTML Help Tips documentation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* Add the ability to rebuild Confluence's indexes upon the startup

h3. Why this is important  

* Currently we don't have a way of triggering Confluence's reindexing by starting it up without having to clear the indexes from scratch.
fields.summary: Rebuild Confluence's indexes on startup

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the *Page Properties Report* lists results in more than 1 page, the *Handy Status* macro no longer allows to change status
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.15.9
 * [Handy Macros for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214971/handy-macros-for-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview] 3.0.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open *Space tools* > *Apps* and then create a Status set with 2 different statuses under *Handy Macros*
 # Create 2 pages, each with the Page Properties macro, containing a table such as:
|Description |<enter some text>|
|Status |<insert a Handy Status macro>|
 # Add the same label, for example "pageprop", to the 2 pages;
 # Create a new page and add the *Page Properties Report* macro, specifying the label created in the previous steps;
 # Viewing the latest page, click on the Status values for each item and change to the other one;
 # Edit the page, change the option *Number of items to display* to 1 and click *Update*;
 # Viewing the page, click on the Status value for the item displayed;

fields.description:
For privacy/confidentiality concerns, it's not enough to be able to delete space watchers, we need to disable watching. We have a large enterprise and can't disable watching across the enterprise so we need to be able to completely disable watching on a space basis. Preferably configurable under Permissions or a simple check-box on Manage Watchers.

Stylesheet allows the removal of the Watch button for a space, but does not disable the shortcut (like removing buttons from the header does.) If there is something else we can remove using Stylesheet that would also be acceptable.
fields.summary: Disable Space Watching

fields.description:
Currently after having installed a fresh Confluence instance, administrators get a welcome screen to create a space.

There is no possibility to skip this screen so the admin is enforced to create a space what he just might not want to do at this time. Especially as he can't modify the space key or description at this dialogue.

The situation gets even more annoying, as this screen also shows up while spaces already exist (e.g. for new users with admin privileges). So in most cases it's unnecessary to create another additional space. But the user has to and to remove it afterwards with several clicks.

So please just add a link resp. button to cancel this screen. As well as all other welcome screens and tutorials should be able to be cancelled at any time. (This is already in discussion in other suggestions).
fields.summary: Let administrators skip the welcome screen

fields.description: When a user watches a space, what happens here is that the user becomes automatically a watcher of all the content of the space including pages and blog posts. It would be a great addition to have an option that allows user to *watch* *only pages*. This way, they will not get notified about blog posts.
fields.summary: Provide an option where users can watch pages only.

fields.description:
* Create a new question
 * select any space and look at the dropdown
fields.summary: Icon for space dropdown for Confluence question is ugly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There are very limited options when trying to create a report in Confluence based on Jira project's information. 


h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great to have a more dynamic macro in Confluence to integrate with Jira to create reports on releases for example.
In the example below, customer is trying to use Page Properties Macro and Page Properties Report Macro to try to achieve this goal:

Currently we see a very static information like:
 !report_macro.png|thumbnail!

But it would be great if we had the option to group releases under specific projects, and have an option to count releases and other data for example.
 !Report.png|thumbnail!


h3. Why this is important

At this point the options available are paid third-party plugins and having this new feature would be adding a great value to the Confluence - Jira integration.

h3. Workaround

Use third-party plugins to achieve this.
fields.summary: As a Confluence user I'd like to have options to create reports with information from the Jira projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Page Property Report Macro resulting in additional pagination added whereas all the results are already available on the first page itself. If you try to click the second page it results in browser throwing 500 error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create multiple pages and include the same label names on each page (Say 10 pages).
# Create page property macro on each page and add property ID for only 5 of them. Created Label name should be mapped in the macro.
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-01 at 6.36.09 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a new page and then add a Page Properties Report macro. Specify the label name, Property ID
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-01 at 6.36.45 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Set Page Properties Macro to display 5 items/pages per page

h3. Expected Results

The report should display all the 5 pages on the first page itself and shouldn't present the second page.

h3. Actual Results

Page property macro page display first page with all the results but there is additional pagination being added which leads to confusion and clicking the page 2 button would result in 500 error.

 [^Page Property.har] 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page properties ID breaks the pagination

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an user is created in the LDAP and he/she tries to log in to Confluence before a [directory synchronization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/synchronizing-data-from-external-directories-964961194.html] occurs, then the user might not be properly indexed.

As a result, the user will not be available to many services relying on the [Lucene index|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/content-index-administration-964961390.html], such as [searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/search-964961041.html], [space permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/space-permissions-overview-964960242.html], [page restrictions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/page-restrictions-964960419.html] and _others_.

Some of the symptoms that could be noticed by Confluence users are:
 * Affected users don't appear in the search results.
 * Affected users can't be mentioned in pages.
 * Affected users can't be searched in the macro configuration panel.
 * Affected users can't be assigned to Space Permissions nor to Page Restrictions.
 * Affected users can authenticate to Confluence and navigate through Spaces and Pages, as well as create content.

h3. Environment
This bug only occurs if you are using a [connector to an LDAP|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/connecting-to-an-ldap-directory-964961184.html], such as a MS AD.
The issue was reproduced using a test instance of MS AD, but it might happen if you are using any other LDAP supported in Confluence.

The bug is described with a direct connector to AD, but it can be reproducible when there's an external Crowd between Confluence and the LDAP.

This bug was validated on Confluence *6.13.8* and on *7.0.2*.
This affects both the *Server* and *Data Center* deployments.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
The steps to reproduce are separated in different scenarios that could trigger the bug.

h4. Scenario 1 -- new user
In this scenario the user never existed in AD, and then was properly created in the AD and the user tried to log in before a directory synchronization occurs.

Below are the steps to reproduce the bug.
# Install a Confluence vanilla instance.
# Configure a connector to AD.
 #* Make sure the _Update group memberships when logging in_ option is set to _Every time the user logs in_.
# Confirm the initial synchronization worked successfully.
# In AD, create a new user that is *not* member of the _confluence-users_ group.
 #* The user *must not* be part of any group that gives the _can-use_ global permission.
# Log in as the target user *before* a directory synchronization occurs.
 #* The authentication is successful, but the user cannot navigate on Confluence and will receive a _Not Permitted_ page, since the user is not part of the _confluence-users_ group.
 #* At this point, the user is added to the Lucene index not as a licensed user.
   !lucene.index.img001.png|thumbnail! 
# In AD, add the target user to the _confluence-users_ group.
# Log in to Confluence with the target user again *before* a synchronization occurs.
 #* This time the user is able to authenticate and navigate on Confluence.
 
h5. Expected Results
Confluence triggers an update on the Lucene index, marking the associated record (Lucene document) as a licensed user, since now the user is part of the _confluence-users_ group.
The user is _searchable_ and appears in the [People Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/search-the-people-directory-964961057.html].

h5. Actual Results
The user profile is properly updated in the user directory, but the information in the Lucene index is not updated.
That means the user is not _searchable_ and cannot be found in the People Directory.

Running the directory synchronization will not update the user in the Lucene index, unless something changes on the AD side.

h4. Scenario 1a -- new user
In this scenario the user is properly created in AD and logs in _after_ a directory synchronization occurs.

Below are the steps to reproduce the bug.
# Install a Confluence vanilla instance.
# Configure a connector to AD. 
#* None of the AD groups should confer can-use access. 
#* Make sure the _Update group memberships when logging in_ option is set to _Every time the user logs in_.
#* Make sure the directory in Confluence is configured to auto-add users to "confluence-users"
# Create a new user in AD
# Confirm the initial synchronization worked successfully
# User should appear on the "Users" screen but should NOT be searchable in the index (cannot be at-mentioned, etc.). This is expected.
# Log in as the new user
# The authentication is successful and the user has access. 
# At-mention the user, or search for them in the People Directory
 
h5. Expected Results
After logging in, the user is re-indexed as a licensed user since they belong to the _confluence-users_ group, and as such and can be mentioned and found in the People Directory. 

h5. Actual Results
The user is not re-indexed as a licensed user, and so cannot be found in any feature that uses the index. Running the directory synchronization will not update the user in the Lucene index, unless something changes on the AD side.

h4. Scenario 2 -- disabled user
In this scenario, the user already existed in AD and was previously (properly) synch'ed with Confluence.
The user is then disabled in AD and then enabled again -- a similar problem occurs if the user is deleted in AD and then re-added..
If the user tries to login before the next directory synchronization, then the bug occurs.


Below are the steps to reproduce the bug.
# Install a Confluence vanilla instance.
# Configure a connector to AD.
 #* Make sure the _Update group memberships when logging in_ option is set to _Every time the user logs in_.
# Create an user in AD as part of the _confluence-users_ group.
# Force a directory synchronization in Confluence.
# Log in to Confluence as that user.
 #* The user should be able to authenticate and navigate through Confluence.
# In AD, disable the user.
# Force a directory synchronization in Confluence.
 #* At this point, the Lucene index should be updated with this information and the user will not be _searchable_ nor appear in the People Directory.
   !user.directory.img001.png|thumbnail!  !lucene.index.img003.png|thumbnail! 
# Enable the user in AD, but do not trigger a directory synchronization in Confluence.
# Try to log in as the target user in Confluence.
 #* The log in is successful and the user can navigate in Confluence.

h4. Expected Results
Confluence triggers an update on the Lucene index, marking the user record as active, since now the user is enabled in the directory.
The user is _searchable_ and appears in the [People Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/search-the-people-directory-964961057.html].

h4. Actual Results
The user profile is properly updated in the user directory, but the information in the Lucene index is not updated and the user still shows as inactive.
That means the user is not _searchable_ and cannot be found in the People Directory.

Running the directory synchronization will not update the user in the Lucene index, unless something changes on the AD side.

 
h3. Notes
* Subsequent directory synchronizations (manual or automatic) will not trigger an update of the user's profile unless something changes on the user's attributes.
 ** In other words, the affected user will not be re-indexed if nothing changes on the AD side.
 ** This is true whether the directory is configured with full or incremental synchronization.
* In a Data Center instance there may be an additional symptom on which all the use cases work fine in some nodes, but it doesn't work on other nodes -- for example, an user can be mentioned in all nodes, except one.
 ** This could happen if a re-index was manually triggered in specific nodes, which would update the Lucene index with proper information.


h3. Workaround
Try to modify the user details, forcing indexing of that specific user:
# Go to *Cog icon* > *User management* and search for the affected user.
# Access the user profile and click on *Edit Details*.
# Add any sample text to the _About Me_ attribute and click on *Submit*.
# After a couple of minutes, check if the user can be searched.


If the above doesn't work, try to force user indexing for all users.
# Access {{<Confluence Base URL>/admin/force-upgrade.action}}
# In _Upgrade task to run_ select _userIndexingUpgradeTask_.
# Click on _Force Upgrade_.

This will trigger an user indexing task -- if using DC, it will be triggered on all nodes of the cluster.

If this doesn't resolve the issue, then it could be a different bug causing it and a full reindex may help.
fields.summary: If a user tries to log in to Confluence before the record is synchronized with LDAP, then the user is not properly indexed and might not be searchable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When managing watchers of a space, space admins only have the ability to remove 
watchers entirely from the space if they are watching the entire space as opposed to individual pages. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Would like the ability to bulk remove watchers of certain pages entirely from a space in manage watchers as opposed to having to go to each page individually to remove a watcher of that page.
fields.summary: Ability to manage page watches by space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary When using AUI Inline Dialogs according to https://docs.atlassian.com/aui/8.5.1/docs/inline-dialog.html#alignment {quote}If there is not enough room to display an inline dialog with the desired alignment the inline dialog will flip alignment.{quote} Which is true for the example on that page when using *right middle* alignment. The dialog flips as expected. But when using *bottom left* alignment for example the dialog does not flip if the space is constrained and the window runs off the screen. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Add a HTML macro to the right hand side of the page (I used a full width table) # Use exact example with right middle* alignment from [space contrained alignments|https://docs.atlassian.com/aui/8.5.1/docs/inline-dialog.html#alignment] and place on the right hand side of a page, table may make it easier. {code} Right middle alignment, but flips left

Lorem ipsum. Lorem ipsum. Lorem ipsum. Lorem ipsum. Lorem ipsum. Lorem ipsum.

{code} # Click / (hover if configured) and notice how the dialogue flips as intended and is shown on the left # Change the alignment to *bottom left* # Notice now the dialogue runs off the screen if there is enough text h3. Expected Results * It flips alignment to *bottom right* h3. Actual Results * It runs off the page as it does not detect the space constraint h3. Notes This was first noticed using the third-party add Requirement Yogi. I was then able to replicate the same situation using our AUI controls manually. * Also affects *top* alignments as well * I've included a storage format of the page so you can confirm I was using the correct AUI properties. h3. Workaround Currently there is no workaround, due to the dynamic nature of the HTML simple CSS/HTML customimsation is not possible. If a workaround is discovered it will be added here.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the Marketplace is unreachable, UPM 4.0.6 causes Confluence 7.0.1 to hang for 30sec per UI click.
h3. Environment
 * UPM 4.0.6 in Confluence 7.0.1

 * marketplace.atlassian.com non-responsive. This needs to be a timeout, not a straight connection refusal by a firewall.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add entry in /etc/hosts to simulate marketplace being unreachable:
{code:java}
 203.56.8.1 marketplace.atlassian.com
{code}

 # Click anything in Confluence and get ready to wait, and wait....

h3. Expected Results

The Confluence UI should remain responsive even if Marketplace is unreachable.
h3. Actual Results

The result of each click in the UI (eg. clicking on Spaces, or trying to load the Confluence admin screen) takes approximately 30 seconds, giving the impression that Confluence performance is very poor.
h3. Notes

If the IP that marketplace.atlassian.com resolves to refuses or accepts the connection immediately, there is no problem - it's only when the resolved IP fails to connect and eventually times out.

Confluence thread dump on a hanging thread:
{code:java}
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native Method)
at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.doConnect(AbstractPlainSocketImpl.java:350)
- locked [0x00000007bdeaf1e8] (a java.net.SocksSocketImpl)
at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.connectToAddress(AbstractPlainSocketImpl.java:206)
at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.connect(AbstractPlainSocketImpl.java:188)
at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(SocksSocketImpl.java:392)
at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:589) 
at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLConnectionSocketFactory.connectSocket(SSLConnectionSocketFactory.java:339)
at org.apache.http.impl.conn.DefaultHttpClientConnectionOperator.connect(DefaultHttpClientConnectionOperator.java:142)
at org.apache.http.impl.conn.PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager.connect(PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager.java:373)
at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.MainClientExec.establishRoute(MainClientExec.java:394)
at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.MainClientExec.execute(MainClientExec.java:237)
at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.CachingExec.callBackend(CachingExec.java:592)
at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.CachingExec.handleCacheMiss(CachingExec.java:356)
at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.CachingExec.execute(CachingExec.java:275) 
at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.ProtocolExec.execute(ProtocolExec.java:185)
at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.RetryExec.execute(RetryExec.java:89)
at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.RedirectExec.execute(RedirectExec.java:110)
at org.apache.http.impl.client.InternalHttpClient.doExecute(InternalHttpClient.java:185)
at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:83)
at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:108)
at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:56)
at com.atlassian.marketplace.client.impl.CommonsHttpTransport$OperationsImpl.executeMethod(CommonsHttpTransport.java:389)
at com.atlassian.marketplace.client.impl.CommonsHttpTransport$OperationsImpl.get(CommonsHttpTransport.java:303)
at com.atlassian.marketplace.client.impl.CommonsHttpTransport.get(CommonsHttpTransport.java:115)
at com.atlassian.marketplace.client.impl.ApiHelper.getEntityInternal(ApiHelper.java:114)
at com.atlassian.marketplace.client.impl.ApiHelper.getEntity(ApiHelper.java:101)
at com.atlassian.marketplace.client.impl.DefaultMarketplaceClient.getRoot(DefaultMarketplaceClient.java:156)
at com.atlassian.marketplace.client.impl.DefaultMarketplaceClient.applications(DefaultMarketplaceClient.java:121) 
at com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.fetchMpacAppInfo(PacClientImpl.java:228)
at com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.fetchMpacAppInfoForLocalBuild(PacClientImpl.java:252)
at com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.lambda$createMpacAppRef$1(PacClientImpl.java:217)
at com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl$$Lambda$964/1871514796.get(Unknown Source)
at com.atlassian.confluence.cache.DeferredCachedReference.get(DeferredCachedReference.java:61)
at com.atlassian.confluence.cache.TransactionalCacheFactory$TransactionAwareCachedReference.get(TransactionalCacheFactory.java:396)
at com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.mpacApp(PacClientImpl.java:277)
at com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.unknownAppVersion(PacClientImpl.java:281)
at com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.isUnknownProductVersion(PacClientImpl.java:272) 
at com.atlassian.upm.permission.UpmVisibilityImpl.isKnownOrDevelopmentVersion(UpmVisibilityImpl.java:72)
at com.atlassian.upm.permission.UpmVisibilityImpl.isInstallVisible(UpmVisibilityImpl.java:45)
at com.atlassian.upm.conditions.IsPermittedToView.shouldDisplay(IsPermittedToView.java:61)
at com.atlassian.plugin.web.DefaultWebInterfaceManager.filterFragmentsByCondition(DefaultWebInterfaceManager.java:160)
at com.atlassian.plugin.web.DefaultWebInterfaceManager.getDisplayableItems(DefaultWebInterfaceManager.java:113)
at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.web.ConfluenceWebInterfaceManager.getDisplayableItems(ConfluenceWebInterfaceManager.java:78)
at com.atlassian.confluence.web.ConfluenceWebMenuManager.getSectionItems(ConfluenceWebMenuManager.java:48)
at com.atlassian.confluence.web.ConfluenceWebMenuManager.getMenu(ConfluenceWebMenuManager.java:32){code}

h4. Stuck Thread
{{catalina.out}} may report stuck threads that are related to the Marketplace connection:
{code}
		at com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.mpacApp(PacClientImpl.java:277)
		at com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.unknownAppVersion(PacClientImpl.java:281)
		at com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.isUnknownProductVersion(PacClientImpl.java:272)
		at com.atlassian.upm.permission.UpmVisibilityImpl.isKnownOrDevelopmentVersion(UpmVisibilityImpl.java:72)
		at com.atlassian.upm.permission.UpmVisibilityImpl.isInstallVisible(UpmVisibilityImpl.java:45)
		at com.atlassian.upm.conditions.IsPermittedToView.shouldDisplay(IsPermittedToView.java:61)
{code}

h3. Workaround

In Confluence, disable connectivity to Marketplace:

# Navigate to the cog icon > *General Configuration* > *Manage Apps*
# Click on *Settings* at the bottom of the page
# Uncheck *Connect to Atlassian Marketplace* and click *Apply*


h3. Workaround via REST API

If Confluence is completely inaccessible we can use the following REST API to disable connectivity to Marketplace.

{code}
curl -u username:password -X PUT <Confluence Base URL>/rest/plugins/1.0/settings -H 'Content-Type: application/vnd.atl.plugins+json' --data-binary '{"settings":[{"key":"pacDisabled","value":true,"requiresRefresh":true,"defaultCheckedValue":true,"readOnly":false}]}'
{code}

This ticket is also tracked under [UPM-6053|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/UPM-6053]
fields.summary: If the Marketplace is unreachable, UPM causes Confluence 7.0.1 to hang for 30sec per UI click

fields.description:
PDF export creates a new page for each child page on 6.13.0 and onwards.  Previously, all the child pages were included in the parent page.  I have tested on below 2 versions to see the difference:
- [^created_by_6.13.0.pdf] : Each child page created a new page.
- [^created_by_6.0.1.pdf] : No new page for the child page.

The customer wants to have a new option to allow old behavior, so all the child pages can be included to parent without any page break.
fields.summary: PDF export needs an option to allow not creating new page for child page

fields.description: The Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support Tools (ATST) plugin prior to version 1.17.2  which was bundled in Confluence Server & Confluence Data Center before version 7.0.1, allows an unprivileged user to initiate periodic log scans and send the results to a user-specified email address due to a missing authorization check. The email message may contain configuration information about the application that the plugin is installed into.
fields.summary: Improper Authorization in Confluence Server through ATST Plugin - CVE-2019-15005

fields.description:
h3. Desciption
When using a date picker in a Confluence page in other languages the day, month and year order is shown incorrectly. Irrespective of the settings in the configuration or the JVM parameters they always default to mm-dd-yyy if the language is set to any other than US/UK.

h3. Environment
Confluence 7.0.1


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the profile language to a non US/UK language
 # Create a new Confluence page and add a date
 # The picker is shown with the incorrect order for the region/language

h3. Expected Results
The day and month ordering is correct for the region e.g. dd-mm-yyyy

h3. Actual Results
In other languages or regions other than US/UK this is shown as mm-dd-yyyy

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Day/month/year order is shown incorrectly in date picker

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In Confluence Server, the users are able to [disable PDF export|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-disable-pdf-export-for-pages-or-spaces-711361415.html] but not other file format like Word and XML.

Therefore, this is a suggestion to have a bundled option to disable the page export option for specific users or pages, for content like Word and XML.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a way to restrict certain users or groups from exporting pages of specific spaces while still allowing them to have view access.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict page export permissions from specific users or groups

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

If more than one user is editing an Office file with the Atlassian Companion, multiple versions of the document shouldn't be created as the other version isn't incorporating any changes of another user. Either being able to merge changes from multiple users or lock files when editing would fix this issue.

h3. *Workaround*

There is a 3rd party plugin available ([Cenote Lockpoint|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/36199/cenote-lockpoint-attachment-checkout?tab=overview&hosting=server]) which offers the ability to lock documents while they’re being edited.
fields.summary: Block simultaneous edits for Atlassian Companion

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary When a responsive table is resized once while editing the page, the column will only be responsive while there's no empty space at the end of the line. As soon as a space is added to the line, the line breaks. In other words, if there's a huge line with no spaces, the table will be responsive. h3. Environment * Confluence 6.15.X h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create one table with two columns. # Set the table as responsive. # Add text to the tabe. You will see that it is responsive according to the number of text being inserted(more text the column will go to the right). # Move the line that separates the two columns. # Add the text but when you are next to the line that separates the columns, add an empty space. (i) There's a MP4 video reproducing the error. h3. Expected Results * The table will continue to grow to the right since it is responsive. * The empty space char shouldn't be treated as line break. * Table should show "Fixed Width" instead of "Responsive"(After resizing the columns manually). h3. Actual Results The empty space will add a line break, like the table is no longer responsive, but if you do not add the empty space, the line will continue to be responsive. h3. Notes Source code of the table: {code:title=Source code without resizing the responsive column}


dwadawdawdawdawd dawd aw daw aw daw



{code} {code:title=Source code by resizing the responsive column}


dwadawdawdawdawd dawd aw daw aw daw daw dwad aw dw d



{code} (Optional - If Necessary) h3. Workaround There's no workaround
fields.summary: Responsive table will not be responsive if the column was resized

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of July 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#B2D4FF | titleBGColor=#B2D4FF | bgColor=#EAF1FC}
Microsoft has not released any major updates for IE11 since 2015, and has [recently discouraged the use of IE11 as a default browser|https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Windows-IT-Pro-Blog/The-perils-of-using-Internet-Explorer-as-your-default-browser/ba-p/331732].

To allow us to continue to take advantage of modern web standards to deliver improved functionality and the best possible user experience across all of our products, we have decided to end support for IE11. *Confluence 7.4 (LTS) is the last IE11-supported version.*

End of support means we will not fix bugs that are specific to IE11, and will begin to introduce features that aren't compatible with this browser.

Find out more about this change from our [announcement|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Feedback-Forum-articles/Retiring-IE11-support-for-Atlassian-cloud-server-and-data-center/ba-p/1185312].

If you have questions or concerns about this change, please comment on this issue.

{panel}
fields.summary: Plans to end support for IE11
